data.title: Make some turreted units required to stop before shooting
data.body:
I would like "AttackTurreted: " to have a sub-option for "StopToShoot: ", so that the turreted unit cannot keep moving when it fires. 

Some units (like MRLS Rocket Artillery in C&C) are supposed to be able to aim turret to fire, instead of firing only forwards. But right now MRLS can still move while firing, which is unrealistic. It's a piece of heavy artillery, so it should stop, then shoot, and then move again if it wants.

data.title: Added "AutoTargetIgnore:" to ^Building:
data.body:
Added "AutoTargetIgnore:" to ^Building:

This will make units not attack them, to solve the problem of units attacking buildings that don't matter instead of units and guard towers. 
I will edit the guard towers so that they are still auto-targeted.

data.title: Removed the "tip" jutting out of 3 buildings, so they are rectangular in...
data.body:
Removed the "tip" jutting out of 3 buildings, so they are rectangular instead of awkwardly shaped.
- heavy factory
- high tech factory
- ix research center

data.title: general enhancements and fixes to mods
BuildAt: is ignored
data.body: The trait is defined in Buildable.cs but not used anywhere. I could need it in the d2k mod to build light vehicles only at the light factory, but keep it in the same vehicle queue.

data.title: [d2k] Unit stuck on repair pad
data.body:
When I built my wind trap right behind, I could not exit my repair pad. It went south and got stuck... Another unit on the repair pad could not move out, not even the new one.

It worked when I sold the nearby building

data.title: Desync in D2K -- Bazooka
data.body: Why can I not attach files..

data.title: wish: Ping or Flare to mark the spot
data.body:
When playing mulitplayer, sometimes I want to mark a spot.
In spring you can write on map, but a flare would also help us..

data.title: wish: Mouse over conyard show should teamnumber
data.body:
When I play, its hard to see what team I play against.
The colors of some players are impossible to read: white on snow, etc.
And also when I spectate I sometimes forget the teams.

It should allow a mouseover not only to show the name, but also a number for team, if teamnumbers are on.

data.title: [packaging] TilesetBuilder.exe is missing
data.body: TilesetBuilder.exe is a dependency for the d2k extractor although nobody noticed because everyone is downloading the files I guess. This is also useful for modders who don't want to compile the source code themselves.

data.title: Make Lobby connection parallel to all the players or more responsive
data.body: It looks like players in the Lobby can't act in parallel manner. ATM Lobby connection allows players make thair actions one by one. For example, Player_1 wanna choose his color. He is moving color slider to another position. Then another Player_2 wanna change his team and he changes it from team 1 to 2nd one. His action brings about cancellation of unfinished action of Player_1.  He has to choose his color again because he hadn't time to click OK to finish color change.

data.title: d2k improvements as suggested by playtesters
[editor] crash when loaded outside OpenRA directory
data.body:
`mono --debug /usr/share/openra/OpenRA.Editor.exe d2k` will crash

> An exception was thrown by the type initializer for OpenRA.Fileformats.Mod ---> System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Directory 'mods' not found

`cd /usr/share/openra` and `mono OpenRA.Editor.exe d2k` will work however.

Also happens with other mods. Has been reported by a Windows user first.

data.title: [d2k] Not getting money back when moving mcv
data.body: When you pack up mcv, you get no money for the construction you started.. Not sure if its meant like that, or if the bug is in ra..

data.title: more urgent d2k fixes
data.body: I also had problems pushing in my regular bleed branch because of rebasing.

data.title: All Text Red in Notepad++
data.body: I'm new to open RA and YAML so maybe I dont understand this fully. Whenever I open a YAML in Notepad++ (Like weapons.yaml) all the text is in red and i'm pretty sure that is not normal. I also tried opening YAML files in Geany and the same thing happened, all red. In notepad++ I did check the box in settings to change tab to space but that did not fix it. Is there a certain editor to use I dont know about? Any help in solving this is appreciated.

data.title: Units dont move when ordered to inaccesible terrain
data.body:
Yo,

when you ordered infantry units in original game to inaccessible terrain (like hills that could only be accessed by helicopters or planes), they still moved to this directon and moved as close as possible to that destination.
Which was a good thing.

In OpenRA, when you order them to inaccessible terrain, they dont do anything at all.

This is very annoying, even if it's meant as a feature instead of a bug.
Consider situations like the following:

You just started a game and build some riflemen or dogs to explore terrain. Now you want to order them to a certain destination in the shroud, which they should explore.
Now, it happens very often, that you accidentely click inaccessible terrain when clicking into the shroud.
If you're lucky, you notice that your rifemen dont move, and then you have to click into the blue (well, black) as long as you find a destination where they can walk to - which is quite annoying as you cannot see where ur clicking.  O.O
Its really annoying.

This is maybe also true for vehicles in OpenRA.
## <bountysource-plugin>

data.title: lag - unplayable
data.body: Very impressed with open ra, really looking forward to some modding. However, the ra mod lags after about 5 mins of play to the point of unplayable. It will run smooth for about 3-4 seconds then lag and skip ahead several frames. It also seems to get progressively worse as time goes on. Any ideas any fixes? I run win 7 64 bit and use a gtx570.

data.title: OS X Mountain Lion and above doesn't support X11
data.body:
Upon launching OpenRA wants to install X11 and links to the following Knowledge base article, which no longer exists.

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT5220

Adjusting instructions to point to:

http://xquartz.macosforge.org/landing/

leaves the user with a working install of OpenRA.

data.title: Pathing improvements
data.body: Units no longer consider other moving units as obstacles. However, units moving in the opposite direction are considered as obstacles which helps avoid pathing deadlocks when two units are facing each other and are cell-adjacent.

data.title: Sound engine improvements to reduce clipping
data.body: Prevent too many instances of a single sound playing at once near each other and attenuate volume of new sounds based on number of active sounds already playing.

data.title: auto group teams
data.body:
Forgive me for posting just to make a feature request, not an actual bug;

One thing that I have always been waiting in vain for cnc to add is automatic team creation. It is an OCD of mine to team units the second they come out of the barracks. 

Selecting units with the mouse was always a pig of an interface decision in my opinion, you dont have quick or accurate enough control, and you end up with finger strain! plus it isn't any reflection of the intense level of organisation in real world militaries. 

Perhaps if you hold control while adding units to the queue, the interface could get the hint and add those units to the first available empty team number, until the numbers are exhausted.  That seems to me the simplest way rather than the most exacting, but since I generally add units to the queue in growth 'spurts', anything more complicated might just be overkill. You can always quickly reassign teams anyway.

Projecting even further, it would be cool to have the teams represented as buttons on the gui somewhere, with little pips and icons - remember Battlezone?

So that is my two cents - a small feature with large implications. It may just be me, but since the interface is obviously not slavishly constrained to the original model, I thought it might be worth mentioning.

data.title: A-star debug overlay
data.body: Nice visualization of A\* search cost per cell with per-player color tints.

data.title: Mouse-wheel support for switching tabs in build palette
data.body: Per Kanar's request.

data.title: Better exception logging on crash
data.body: Now including InnerException details and the option to format custom exception types.
